avalancheActivity.comment:
In particular below approximately 2100 m: In starting zones where no previous releases have taken place and on very steep slopes individual small and medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible as a consequence of the rain.

10 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell during the night above approximately 2200 m. As a consequence of new snow and northwesterly wind, sometimes deep wind slabs will form in particular in places that are protected from the wind. These can be released by a single winter sport participant in some cases at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions. The avalanche prone locations for dry avalanches are to be found in particular on wind-loaded slopes and in gullies and bowls above approximately 2600 m. The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.

As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of moist and wet avalanches being released will increase a little in particular on steep sunny slopes below approximately 2200 m.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow above approximately 2000 m. Below approximately 2100 m: Increase in danger of dry and moist avalanches as a consequence of the rain.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area over a wide area 10 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell on Saturday above approximately 2200 m. New snow and wind slabs are lying on a moist old snowpack. This applies especially on sunny slopes, but in isolated cases also on shady slopes below approximately 2600 m. Below approximately 2000 m a little snow is lying.

Individual weak layers exist in the old snowpack in particular on steep shady slopes.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The older wind slabs can still be released in some cases in particular on steep shady slopes below approximately 2700 m. In some places the avalanches can be released in the old snow and reach quite a large size.

As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the activity of moist and wet avalanches will increase, especially on steep sunny slopes and at low and intermediate altitudes. At high altitudes and in high Alpine regions and in starting zones where no previous releases have taken place more medium-sized natural avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Gradual increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The surface of the snowpack has frozen to form a strong crust and will soften during the day, especially on sunny slopes and at low and intermediate altitudes.
Below approximately 2000 m a little snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to moistening of the snowpack in particular on steep sunny slopes.

In particular on very steep slopes and on wind-loaded slopes individual moist slab avalanches are possible at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions. These can be released, mostly by large loads or triggered naturally.
In starting zones where no previous releases have taken place and in starting zones where no previous releases have taken place more medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large natural avalanches are possible.

Backcountry tours should be started and concluded early.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Gradual increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The surface of the snowpack has frozen to form a strong crust and will soften during the day. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to moistening of the snowpack in particular on steep sunny slopes.

Below approximately 2000 m a little snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Up to 2200 m rain has fallen since yesterday in some regions. In particular steep slopes: The danger of moist snow slides and avalanches will already exist in the early morning.

Also high altitudes and the high Alpine regions: The sleet gave rise to significant moistening of the snowpack. As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation individual mostly small moist and wet avalanches are possible.

Below approximately 1900 m from a snow sport perspective, insufficient snow is lying.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Up to 2200 m rain has fallen since yesterday in some regions. Increase in danger of dry and moist avalanches as a consequence of the rain.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The rain gave rise to extreme and thorough wetting of the old snowpack below approximately 2200 m. The sleet gave rise to significant moistening of the snowpack above approximately 2200 m. The surface of the snowpack will cool hardly at all during the overcast night and will already be soft in the early morning.
Below approximately 1900 m hardly any snow is lying.
